sorular.soru: Can you drive with a 3 metre wide load?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: An indivisible load on a trailer may not be more than 3 metres wide. If the load protrudes more than 10 cm from the side of the trailer, it must be marked with a red and white striped marking plate.

sorular.soru: Can you drive here with a vehicle combination of 8.5 metres long?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: On a motorway with more than two lanes, lorries and vehicles with trailer combinations longer than seven metres may only use the two lanes on the right. This combination is therefore not allowed to drive here. This rule would not apply if you had to pre-sort in this lane.

sorular.soru: Which vehicle is an emergency vehicle?
cevaplar: A tram.
A police vehicle with optical and sound signals.
An animal ambulance with orange flashing lights.
sorular.dogruCevap: A police vehicle with optical and sound signals.

feedback.metin: Only vehicles with optical and sound signals fall under emergency vehicles. These are blue flashing lights and a two-tone horn, or siren. A tram may go first in a lot of situations, but is not an emergency vehicle. A police car with optical and sound signals does fall under the emergency vehicles. An animal ambulance is never an emergency vehicle, because it is not allowed to use blue flashing lights and a siren. With only orange flashing lights it is not an emergency vehicle.

sorular.soru: Is it better to leave the rear window heating on at all times during winter weather conditions?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: Switch off the rear window heating once the rear window has been defrosted and cleared. This is better for the environment, because the rear window heating uses power. In many cars, the rear window heater even switches off automatically to save power.

sorular.soru: What should you do if your vehicle ends up in the soft verge?
cevaplar: Release the accelerator and turn back onto the road at a low speed.
Brake forcefully and turn back onto the road at a low speed.
Maintain speed and turn back onto the road immediately.
sorular.dogruCevap: Release the accelerator and turn back onto the road at a low speed.

feedback.metin: If your vehicle ends up on a soft verge, release the accelerator and wait until you reach a very low speed before turning back onto the road. If you brake forcefully or turn back onto the road at high speed, you will skid across the road.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?
cevaplar: Yes. This is a parking zone.
No. You cannot park here.
Yes. But only with an adjusted parking disc.

feedback.metin: From the sign, you can see that this is a parking zone where the use of a parking disc is mandatory if parked next to a blue line. You may only park here in the designated parking spaces or next to a blue line. If you park next to a blue line, the use of a parking disc is mandatory. In this case, you are not in a designated parking space or next to a blue line. You are not allowed to park here, even with a parking disc.

sorular.soru: You have driven the wrong way. What traffic behaviour do you exhibit here?
cevaplar: Continue driving and turn on the hard shoulder.
Drive on and leave the road at the next opportunity.
Exit the road immediately by reversing.
sorular.dogruCevap: Exit the road immediately by reversing.

feedback.metin: You accidentally drove onto the motorway exit here instead of the entrance. The C-2 sign in combination with the 'Go back' sign underneath means you must go back the way you came as quickly as possible. You can do this by turning around or reversing, depending on the situation and traffic.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the cars in the left lane on the right here?
cevaplar: Only if other drivers keep to the left unnecessarily.
No, overtaking on the right is prohibited here.
Yes, overtaking on the right is allowed in this situation.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, overtaking on the right is prohibited here.

feedback.metin: Overtaking the cars in the left lane on the right is prohibited. You must overtake on the left, and hindering or endangering other road users is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Will the motorway you are on continue with two lanes?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: The motorway you are driving on will continue with three lanes instead of two. The L-101 sign indicates that two carriageways – each with two lanes – will merge to become one carriageway with three lanes. The left lane on the right carriageway will merge directly with the right lane of the left carriageway.

sorular.soru: What is the risk in having a separate navigation system on the windscreen?
cevaplar: It may be more distracting than a built-in system.
You may damage the windscreen when placing it.
It may create an additional blind spot.
sorular.dogruCevap: It may create an additional blind spot.

feedback.metin: Always be careful when placing navigation systems on the front windscreen. If possible, try to place these near the bottom or in a corner of the windscreen. While it is a small device, cyclists and sometimes even cars can disappear behind it. Windscreen-mounted navigation systems create an extra blind spot that you must consciously remember to check. It is unlikely that placing such a system will damage the windscreen, as the systems are designed to avoid this. The level of distraction is about the same as that of a built-in system.

sorular.soru: Should you wear a seat belt when reversing?
cevaplar: No, you must wear a seat belt for forward driving only.
Yes, you must wear a seat belt for reverse driving only.
Yes, you must wear a seat belt for both reverse and forward driving.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes, you must wear a seat belt for both reverse and forward driving.

feedback.metin: Drivers and passengers must wear a seat belt at all times. Driving with more passengers than available seat belts is not allowed under any circumstances.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive on?
cevaplar: Yes. But you are only allowed to drive straight on.
Yes. But you can only turn right.
No. You cannot drive on yet.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You cannot drive on yet.

feedback.metin: The traffic controller is giving a stop sign for traffic approaching from behind, which means you have to stop here.

sorular.soru: Should you indicate direction when overtaking a motorcycle?
cevaplar: Yes. When moving to the left or right lane.
Yes. Only when moving to the left lane.
No. Only when overtaking motor vehicles with more than two wheels.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. When moving to the left or right lane.

feedback.metin: Indicating before overtaking other motor vehicles is mandatory. This is mandatory for any ‘important lateral movement’, including moving to the left or right lane.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive if you are suffering from a severe headache?
cevaplar: Yes. This is allowed.
No. This is prohibited.
Only if you cannot arrange anything else.

feedback.metin: If you are suffering from a severe headache, driving is unwise and therefore prohibited. If you do have to travel somewhere, arrange for someone to take you.

sorular.soru: You want to park. In which situation do you need a parking disc?
cevaplar: Only situation A.
Only situation B.
In both situations.
In none of the situations.

feedback.metin: Situation A is a parking disc zone. Here the use of a parking disc is compulsory in places with a blue line. Situation B is a permit holder zone. Here, only drivers who have a parking permit for this zone are allowed to park. They must have the parking permit visible behind the windscreen, but a parking disc is not required.

sorular.soru: What does this sign indicate?
cevaplar: Passing area to the right of the road.
Lay-by to the right of the road.
Prepare to turn.
sorular.dogruCevap: Passing area to the right of the road.

feedback.metin: This sign indicates a passing area to the right of the road. These places are built on narrow roads where passing and overtaking is not possible or dangerous. Slow traffic can also let faster traffic pass here.

sorular.soru: In what situation does overly low tyre pressure affect road holding?
cevaplar: This always affects road holding.
Only if the road surface is new.
Only if the road surface is wet.

feedback.metin: Under-inflated tyres always affect road holding, regardless of the road surface. It is therefore advisable to check your vehicle’s tyre pressure at least once a month. You should also check the condition of your tyres before every journey.

sorular.soru: Do you still have time to switch to the pre-sorting lane to go straight on?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: You can no longer change lanes here. The bus lane is marked with solid lines, which means you cannot cross them. You must turn right here.

sorular.soru: The weight of the combination you are driving is 3600 kg. The maximum authorised mass of the trailer is 700 kg. Which driving licence do you at least need for this?
cevaplar: Driving licence B.
Driving licence BE.
Driving licence C1E.

feedback.metin: Because the maximum authorised mass of your trailer is less than 750 kg, only a B driving licence is sufficient – even if the combination is heavier than 3500 kg. The towing vehicle itself weighs less than 3500 kg, therefore a C or C1 driving licence is not required.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to use your rear fog light when visibility is about 40 metres?
cevaplar: Yes. This is always allowed.
Yes. But only in snowfall or fog.
No. That is not allowed.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. But only in snowfall or fog.

feedback.metin: If visibility is less than 50 metres due to fog or snowfall, rear fog lights may be used.

sorular.soru: Within how many metres of a pedestrian crossing are you not allowed to wait or park?
cevaplar: 5 metres.
10 metres.
15 metres.

feedback.metin: Waiting or parking within 5 metres of a pedestrian crossing is prohibited.

sorular.soru: You want to take the exit further on. Are you allowed to overtake the stationary vehicles on the right?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: You are only allowed to use the hard shoulder in case of emergency. The fact that you have to wait before you can enter the deceleration lane, is not an emergency. So, you are not allowed to use the hard shoulder to reach the deceleration lane, but must simply join the back of the traffic jam.

sorular.soru: Which lights are best used here?
cevaplar: Full-beam headlights and rear fog light.
Dipped headlights and rear fog lights.
Dipped headlights or front fog lights.
sorular.dogruCevap: Dipped headlights or front fog lights.

feedback.metin: Drivers of motor vehicles and disabled vehicles must use dipped headlights in the dark or during fog, snowfall, or rain if visibility is seriously obstructed. Dipped headlights may be replaced or combined with the front fog lights. Using full-beam headlights is very unwise in the event of snowfall as the glare may blind you. Rear fog lights are prohibited when visibility is more than 50 metres or during rain.

sorular.soru: Which meter or meters should be clearly legible in the dark?
cevaplar: All meters on the dashboard.
The speedometer, the odometer, and the rev counter.
Only the speedometer.

feedback.metin: Of all the meters in the dashboard, only the speedometer needs to be clearly readable, even in the dark. In the vast majority of vehicles, however, other gauges will also be illuminated, such as the rev counter, fuel gauge, and temperature gauge. However, these are not mandatory.

sorular.soru: Are snorfiets riders allowed to ride next to each other?
cevaplar: Yes. That is allowed.
No. That is prohibited.
No. But they are allowed to ride next to a cyclist.

feedback.metin: Snorfiets riders and moped riders are not allowed to ride next to each other. Nor are they allowed to ride next to a cyclist. Only cyclists are allowed to ride next to each other.

sorular.soru: You are a novice driver and have 1.0 per mille of alcohol in your blood when you stopped. Can the police confiscate your driving licence?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: If you are a novice driver and the alcohol level in your blood is 0.8 per mille or more when you are pulled over, the police must take your driving licence. Your driving licence will be sent to the public prosecutor's office together with the official report. The public prosecutor will then decide on further action. For experienced drivers, this is 1.3 per mille.

sorular.soru: Is transporting a child like this permitted?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: Children under 1.35 metres tall must use an approved car seat or booster seat. Children over 1.35 metres tall must use the vehicle seat belt, whether or not in combination with a booster seat. The upper part of the belt must be in front of the chest and over the shoulder. Seat belts must never pass over the neck. In this case, the seat belt is too close to the child’s neck and face.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the coach?
cevaplar: No. Because the bus is on the right-hand side of a solid line.
Yes. This coach driver is indicating that they want to pull away from the bus stop.
No. The coach driver is performing a special manoeuvre.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. This coach driver is indicating that they want to pull away from the bus stop.

feedback.metin: In built-up areas, you must allow bus drivers, including coaches, to pull away from bus stops when they indicate as such. This rule only applies if the bus driver uses their indicator and only within built-up areas.

sorular.soru: What should you do when this light comes on?
cevaplar: Drive on to a safe stop and refill the engine oil immediately.
Stop as soon as possible and check the oil level, or call the breakdown service.
Drive on to a safe stop and check the oil level.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop as soon as possible and check the oil level, or call the breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If this light comes on, you must stop as soon as possible as it indicates a problem with the oil pressure. If you continue driving, the engine may break down entirely. If it is safe to do so, check the oil yourself. If you cannot do this safely, for example because you are on a hard shoulder, call the (breakdown) emergency service.

sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: This lane is closed, as indicated by the red cross on the digital sign above the lane. You cannot drive here.

sorular.soru: What does this sign mean?
cevaplar: An overtaking ban for passenger cars.
An overtaking ban for motor vehicles on more than two wheels.
A ban for all motor vehicles to overtake each other.
sorular.dogruCevap: A ban for all motor vehicles to overtake each other.

feedback.metin: The F-1 sign indicates a prohibition for motor vehicles to overtake each other. The number of wheels or the type of motor vehicle does not matter here. This sign also applies, for example, to motorcycles and tractors.

sorular.soru: Can you drop someone off here?
cevaplar: Yes.
No.

feedback.metin: You may not park or stop on or within 5 metres of a crossing.

sorular.soru: Does a passenger car have to be fitted with sidelights?
cevaplar: Yes. Two sidelights at the front are mandatory.
No. Sidelights are no longer mandatory. Daytime running lights are now sufficient.
No. Sidelights are no longer mandatory. Dipped headlights are now sufficient.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. Two sidelights at the front are mandatory.

feedback.metin: A passenger car must be equipped with two properly functioning sidelights at the front.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum added load weight if the maximum authorised roof load is 75 kg and the roof box, roof rails, and other accessories together weigh 25 kg?
cevaplar: Maximum of 25 kg.
Maximum of 50 kg.
Maximum of 100 kg.

feedback.metin: The maximum authorised roof load is the maximum weight you can place on a passenger car’s roof - the total weight of the roof rails, roof rack, roof box, other attachments, and load. This weight can be found in the passenger car’s instruction manual. If the maximum roof load is 75 kg, and the roof box with all attachments is 25 kg, there is 50 kg left for the load.
